fields.content: He can move faster than Severus Snape confronted with shampoo.
fields.subject: The Boy Who Lived

fields.content: I am a wizard, not a baboon brandishing a stick.
fields.subject: Hallowe'en

fields.content: Mr. and Mrs. Dursley of number four, Privet Drive, were proud to say that they were perfectly normal, thank you very much.
fields.subject: The Midnight Duel

fields.content: I hope you're pleased with yourselves. We could all have been killed — or worse, expelled. Now if you don't mind, I'm going to bed.
fields.subject: Diagon Alley

fields.content: It does not do well to dwell on dreams and forget to live.
fields.subject: The Letters from No One

fields.content: To the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure.
fields.subject: Norbert the Norwegian Ridgeback

fields.content: You're a little scary sometimes, you know that? Brilliant ... but scary.
fields.subject: The Worst Birthday

fields.content: There will be no foolish wand-waving or silly incantations in this class. As such, I don't expect many of you to appreciate the subtle science and exact art that is potion-making. However, for those select few who possess the predisposition, I can teach you how to bewitch the mind and ensnare the senses. I can tell you how to bottle fame, brew glory, and even put a stopper in death. Then again, maybe some of you have come to Hogwarts in possession of abilities so formidable that you feel confident enough to not pay attention!
fields.subject: At Flourish and Blotts

fields.content: It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends.
fields.subject: Through the Trapdoor

fields.content: Yer a wizard Harry.
fields.subject: The Potions master

fields.content: There are some things you can’t share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.
fields.subject: The Mirror of Erised

fields.content: Training for the ballet, Potter?
fields.subject: The Man With Two Faces

fields.content: Honestly, if you were any slower, you’d be going backward.
fields.subject: The Keeper of Keys

fields.content: Don’t let the muggles get you down.
fields.subject: The Vanishing Glass

fields.content: Don’t put your wand there, boy! … Better wizards than you have lost buttocks, you know.
fields.subject: The Journey From Platform Nine and Three-Quarters

fields.content: Why, dear boy, we don’t send wizards to Azkaban just for blowing up their aunts.
fields.subject: Dobby's Warning

fields.content: Earwax.
fields.subject: The Writing On The Wall

fields.content: Percy wouldn’t notice a joke if it danced naked in front of him wearing one of Dobby’s hats.
fields.subject: Aragog

fields.content: Ron’s old Shooting Star was often outstripped by passing butterflies.
fields.subject: Gilderoy Lockhart

fields.content: Why are you worrying about YOU-KNOW-WHO, when you should be worrying about YOU-NO-POO? The constipation sensation that’s gripping the nation!
fields.subject: Snape's Prediction

fields.content: Yeah, Quirrell was a great teacher. There was just that minor drawback of him having Lord Voldemort sticking out of the back of his head!
fields.subject: Professor Trelawney's Prediction

fields.content: Did you really…Did it go all right? I – I mean… that – that was very wrong, boys – very wrong indeed…
fields.subject: Grim Defeat

fields.content: Your sons flew that car to Harry’s house and back last night! … What have you got to say about that, eh?
fields.subject: Owl Post

fields.content: Wild! I can make that old bloke down there pick his nose again… and again… and again…
fields.subject: Aunt Marge's Big Mistake

fields.content: Anyone can speak Troll. All you have to do is point and grunt.
fields.subject: The Leaky Cauldron

fields.content: Gotta bone ter pick with yeh. I’ve heard you’ve bin givin’ out signed photos. How come I haven’t got one?
fields.subject: The Boggart In The Wardrobe

fields.content: I assure you that if you die, you need not hand your homework in.
fields.subject: Talons and Tea Leaves

fields.content: Have you got a house? When can I move in?
fields.subject: Gryffindor Versus Ravenclaw

fields.content: Mischief Managed!
fields.subject: The Patronus

fields.content: I am what I am, an' I'm not ashamed. 'Never be ashamed,' my ol' dad used ter say, 'there's some who'll hold it against you, but they're not worth botherin' with.
fields.subject: Flight Of The Fat Lady

fields.content: We are only as strong as we are united, as weak as we are divided
fields.subject: Career Advice

fields.content: It matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be.
Your devotion is nothing more than cowardice. You would not be here if you had anywhere else to go.
fields.subject: Grawp

fields.content: Twitchy little ferret, aren’t you, Malfoy?
fields.subject: Seen and Unforeseen

fields.content: Just because it’s taken you three years to notice, Ron, doesn’t mean no one else has spotted I’m a girl!
fields.subject: Educational Decree Number Twenty-Four

fields.content: Give her hell from us, Peeves.
fields.subject: Dudley Demented

fields.content: I think I'll just go down and have some pudding and wait for it all to turn up — it always does in the end.
fields.subject: Peck of Owls

fields.content: You can laugh, but people used to believe there were no such things as the Blibbering Humdinger or the Crumple-Horned Snorkack!
fields.subject: Twelve, Grimmauld Place

fields.content: Things we lose have a way of coming back to us in the end, if not always in the way we expect.
fields.subject: The Hog's Head

fields.content: You’re just as sane as I am.
fields.subject: Hogwarts High Inquisitor

fields.content: Wit beyond measure is man’s greatest treasure.
fields.subject: Detention With Dolores

fields.content: There is no need to call me ‘sir,’ Professor.
fields.subject: Woas of Mrs. Weasley

fields.content: Once again, you show all the sensitivity of a blunt axe.
fields.subject: Advance Gaurd

fields.content: WHY IS IT ALWAYS ME?
fields.subject: Priori Incantatem

fields.content: You and what army?
fields.subject: Veritaserum

fields.content: I'll join you! ... When hell freezes over LOLOL!
fields.subject: Madness of Mr. Crouch

fields.content: I'm worth twelve of you, Malfoy!
fields.subject: Aboard the Hogwarts Express

fields.content: I feel like I can spit fire... is that bad?
fields.subject: Padfoot Returns

fields.content: Hmmm, difficult. VERY difficult.
fields.subject: Egg and Eye

fields.content: There's talent, oh yes.
fields.subject: Yule Ball

fields.content: Ah, go boil yer heads, both of yeh.
fields.subject: Mayhem At The Ministry

fields.content: Ah, well, people can be stupid abou’ their pets.
fields.subject: The Hungarian Horntail

fields.content: Six years to the day we met, Harry, d’yeh remember it?
fields.subject: The First Task

fields.content: Well, it may have escaped your notice, but life isn’t fair.
fields.subject: The Scar

fields.content: Tut, tut — fame clearly isn’t everything.
fields.subject: The Portkey

fields.content: Yes, it is easy to see that nearly six years of magical education have not been wasted on you, Potter. Ghosts are transparent.
fields.subject: Hermione's Secret

fields.content: It's very boring, having to listen to the silly little troubles of an eleven-year-old girl.
fields.subject: The Servant of Lord Voldermoret

fields.content: ...just because he found out his wife was a witch?
fields.subject: The Marauder's Map

fields.content: How is it that you - a skinny boy with no extraordinary magical talent - managed to defeat the greatest wizard of all time?
fields.subject: Cat, Rat, and Dog

fields.content: Voldemort, is my past, present, and future.
fields.subject: The Firebolt
